meanings.definition: The reduction in the number of inhabitants in a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The depopulation of the town led to empty streets and closed shops.
meanings.sent2: The government implemented policies to address the depopulation of rural areas.
meanings.sent3: The depopulation of the zoo made the monkeys the new rulers of the park.
meanings.sent4: The depopulation of the forest left it eerily quiet, like a ghost town.
meanings.sent5: The depopulation of the island was so severe that only a few lonely souls remained.

meanings.definition: The act of causing a decrease in population size.
meanings.sent1: The depopulation of the city was a result of the factory closures.
meanings.sent2: The depopulation of the fish tank was due to overfeeding.
meanings.sent3: The depopulation of the classroom during recess was like a mass exodus.
meanings.sent4: The depopulation of the garden was caused by the invasive species taking over.
meanings.sent5: The depopulation of the party happened quickly once the music stopped.
